entry.title: Mass rallies against Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade in Yerevan and Stepanakert

media:group.media:title: Mass rallies against Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade in Yerevan and Stepanakert
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe foreign ministers of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Russia will meet in Moscow tomorrow for another round of negotiations. üìçOrganizers are planning simultaneous mass rallies in Yerevan and Stepanakert tomorrow to call on Azerbaijan to lift its seven-month blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçThe International Committee of the Red Cross evacuated 11 people from Nagorno-Karabakh to Armenia for medical treatment. üìçRussian peacekeepers refused to allow a group of Nagorno-Karabakh residents to enter the region from Armenia via the Lachin corridor. üìçArmenia‚Äôs tech entrepreneurs gathered at Lake Sevan for this year‚Äôs Sevan Startup Summit.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: A walk through the streets of blockaded Karabakh

media:group.media:title: A walk through the streets of blockaded Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Today, it is rare to see cars passing through the streets in Nagorno Karabakh (Artsakh). The region has been under a total blockade for more than seven months. Last month, Azerbaijan also banned the entry of humanitarian goods to Karabakh. Without fuel, Stepanakert‚Äôs public transportation is almost non-existent, and regional transportation is operating with a limited schedule. Let's take a walk through Stepanakert‚Äôs central streets to get a glimpse of the people‚Äôs daily reality.

entry.title: Armenia working to comply with Russia sanctions: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia working to comply with Russia sanctions: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçA number of senior Armenian government officials have stressed that Armenia is working to comply with international sanctions against Russia. üìçArmenia is building a checkpoint on its side of a key bridge to Turkey, even though there is still no date for the two countries‚Äô border to reopen. üìçArmenia said it had not received a purported letter from Azerbaijan demanding a halt to the construction of a scrap metal plant on the two countries‚Äô border.

entry.title: Miscarriages surge in Karabakh amid widespread food shortages

media:group.media:title: Miscarriages surge in Karabakh amid widespread food shortages
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe number of early-stage miscarriages in Nagorno-Karabakh have nearly tripled in the past month, according to a leading doctor in Stepanakert, who cited stress and the lack of a balanced diet amid Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade. üìçCanada is set to join the European Union‚Äôs border monitoring mission in Armenia, becoming the first non-EU country to participate. üìçArmenia approved plans to open an embassy in Uruguay by the end of the year. It will be the country‚Äôs third diplomatic mission in South America. üìçArmenia‚Äôs State Symphony Orchestra will perform a suite of film scores by the renowned Armenian composer Tigran Mansurian in Gyumri tomorrow.
